meta_title: Why Maintenance KPIs Don't Improve: Root Causes & Solutions
meta_description: Maintenance KPIs stagnate due to reliance on lagging indicators, poor data integrity (pencil whipping), and unmanaged backlogs that fuel reactive cycles.
title: Why Maintenance KPIs Don't Improve: Diagnosing the Stagnation of Reliability Metrics

hero_image.alt: Hero image for Why Maintenance KPIs Don't Improve: Diagnosing the Stagnation of Reliability Metrics

image_prompt: A high-resolution, photo-realistic image of a maintenance manager in a modern manufacturing facility, wearing a hard hat and reflective vest, looking frustrated at a digital dashboard showing stagnant red and yellow KPI charts. In the background, a technician is working on a complex conveyor system. The lighting is industrial but clear, highlighting the contrast between the digital data and the physical machinery. No text on the screen.
